text: Philip Morris Kedward (26 July 1909 – 3 September 1996) was an English first- class cricketer. Kedward, who was born at Hull in July 1909, made a single appearance in first-class cricket for H. D. G. Leveson-Gower's XI against Oxford University at Reigate in 1935. Batting once in the match, he was dismissed without scoring in the HDG Leveson-Gower's XI first-innings by Tristan Ballance. He died in September 1996 at Willesborough, Kent. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1909 births Category:1996 deaths Category:People from Kingston upon Hull Category:English cricketers Category:H. D. G. Leveson Gower's XI cricketers
title: Philip Kedward
